conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
ΔU is the change in internal energy, Q is the heat exchanged, W is the work done by the gas.
Determine the change in internal energy (ΔU): Given ΔU = 200 J.
The work done by a gas during a state change is the area under the curve in a p-V diagram.
From state A to B, the process is isobaric (constant pressure).
Calculate work done from A to B: W_AB = P ΔV = p_B (V_B - V_A).
From state B to C, the process is isochoric (constant volume), so no work is done.
From the diagram: p_B = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3, V_B = 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate W_AB: W_AB = 3 x 10^5 x (4 x 10^-3 - 1 x 10^-3) = 900 J.
Total work done: W = W_AB + W_BC = 900 J + 0 = 900 J.
Apply the first law of thermodynamics: Q = ΔU + W.
Substitute the known values: Q = 200 J + 900 J = 1100 J.
Determine the sign of the heat exchange: Since ΔU > 0 and W > 0, Q > 0.
The heat Q exchanged between the gas and the environment is 1100 J.
